item.title: Overgrown weeds/ivy coming through the fence into our alleyway, 8th September
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise a concern regarding the ongoing issue of overgrown weeds, ivy, and tree branches coming through the fence from the car park into the back alley that provides access to my property. This has been a persistent problem for a number of years. In the past, I have regularly cleared the growth myself, but it quickly returns every couple of months. I am currently cutting it back again however, with two young children to care for, I no longer have the time or ability to manage this continual maintenance. The overgrowth not only looks unsightly but also obstructs safe use of the alleyway. If left unmanaged, it will inevitably worsen and cause further difficulty for both myself and other residents who require access. I kindly request that the council arrange for this area to be properly maintained, and that a longer-term solution is put in place to prevent the overgrowth from continually spilling through the fence into the alley. Please confirm when this matter will be investigated and provide details of the action that will be taken. I would appreciate a response within the council’s standard timescales. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Kind regards Katie James

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackthorn Grove, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George's flags STILL on the zebra crossing, 8th September
item.description:
You might consider it acceptable to have a group intimidating another group with this stuff, but we don't live in Belfast. Get this sorted ASAP. not only is it really unnerving to not know which of your neighbours wants to 'reclaim their country' and send you home,but it renders the zebra crossing illegal as it no longer complies.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 389, Hurst Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally posted England flags all around Sidcup Bypass Roundabout causing racial tension, 8th September
item.description:
This is just terrifying. It's like we're in Belfast. Pure racial tension being stoked up by 3am bandits. The same no doubt that cut down pelican crossing lights with ULEZ cameras.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup By-pass, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
